block.p: Michelle Taryn Friedland, the daughter of Sandra and Thomas S. Friedland of Scotch Plains, N.J., was married yesterday to Daniel James Kelly, a son of Marilyn and James F. Kelly of Montgomery Village, Md. Judge Philip S. Carchman of the Appellate Division of State Superior Court in Trenton, officiated at the Grounds for Sculpture in Hamilton, N.J.
The bride and bridegroom, both 27, met at Stanford University, from which he graduated and she received a master's degree in electrical engineering.

Michelle Taryn Friedland, the daughter of Sandra and Thomas S. Friedland of Scotch Plains, N.J., was married yesterday to Daniel James Kelly, a son of Marilyn and James F. Kelly of Montgomery Village, Md. Judge Philip S. Carchman of the Appellate Division of State Superior Court in Trenton, officiated at the Grounds for Sculpture in Hamilton, N.J.
The bride and bridegroom, both 27, met at Stanford University, from which he graduated and she received a master's degree in electrical engineering.

Ms. Friedland, who is keeping her name, studied ethics and political philosophy at Oxford University, where she was a Fulbright scholar. She received a law degree from Stanford this month, and on Aug. 1 is to become a law clerk for Judge David S. Tatel of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. Next year, she is to become a clerk for Justice Sandra Day O'Connor of the Supreme Court.

Her father is the president of Harper Industries, a clothing manufacturer and importer in Clark, N.J., and an economics lecturer at Rutgers University in New Brunswick, N.J. Her mother is a writing instructor at Kean University in Union, N.J., and at the Cranford campus of Union County College. She is also a freelance medical writer and editor.

Mr. Kelly is a design engineer for wireless communications technology at Cisco Systems in San Jose, Calif. He graduated summa cum laude from the University of Maryland at College Park. His mother, a registered nurse, is the site coordinator of the shingles prevention study at the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases in Bethesda, Md. His father is a physicist at the National Institute of Standards and Technology in Gaithersburg, Md.

WEDDINGS Correction: June 25, 2000, Sunday A report last Sunday about the wedding of Michelle Taryn Friedland and Daniel James Kelly misstated the degrees they received from Stanford University. She received a bachelor's degree, and he received a master's in electrical engineering, not vice versa.

A report last Sunday about the wedding of Michelle Taryn Friedland and Daniel James Kelly misstated the degrees they received from Stanford University. She received a bachelor's degree, and he received a master's in electrical engineering, not vice versa.
